column1: xompeii 160709336323 "2017-05-15 22:11:22 GMT" https://xompeii.tumblr.com/post/160709336323/recently-found-this-on-facebook-and-it-sums-up-my "the-zoo-is-in-town: This is AMAZING! For those who can‚Äôt go to the link
column2: the following is what it says: FYI
column3: none of this is mine. It was posted by Bilton veterinary centre
column4: the same one as in the picture. All credit goes to them but I felt it was important to get word out about some of the breeds of dogs that are riddled with health problems. If you own a pug that‚Äôs perfectly healthy that‚Äôs cool
column5: but it‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt change the fact that an alarming number of short nosed (almost no nosed at this point) dogs have extreme difficulty with tasks like breathing and blinking. ¬†""So I am going to have a rant now and I apologise in advance if this upsets anyone
column6: but here goes. ¬†¬†  Last week
column7: I managed to reduce a lovely family to floods of tears. ¬†They had brought their new dog in to come and see me. ¬†There was a young lady
column8: her husband and their two children of about 8 or 9 years old and they were all already absolutely besotted with their new pet - their first dog
column9: and they had been planning it for several years. ¬†¬†  The dog was a 5-month-old French Bulldog that they had picked up from a breeder about 4 weeks previously. ¬†They were concerned that their new dog may have ‚Äúa chill‚Äù as the dog had sore runny eyes
column10: ¬†difficulty in eating and kept making a choking sound. ¬†They had also noticed the dog had a ‚Äúfunny smell‚Äù about him.  As I examined the dog it became quickly apparent what was occurring and my heart sank. ¬†¬†This dog was yet another increasingly popular ‚Äúshort-nosed‚Äù breed that was suffering horribly from a myriad of problems - all related to its poor breeding and its unfortunate anatomy.  After the examination
column11: I found that this dog had:¬† ¬†- Eyeballs too big for its eye sockets. So much so
column13: the eyelids didn‚Äôt fully cover the eyeballs. ¬†(Imagine going out on a windy day and not being able to blink!) This had resulted in deep painful ulcers forming on both eyes that in the short term would require intensive treatment and could feasibly result in the rupture of one or both eyeballs.¬† ¬†  - The bones forming the front of his face (the maxilla) were so squashed by virtue of this style of this breed (called the brachycephalics)
column14: that the soft-tissue structures of the throat are compressed and forced backwards¬†- ¬†obstructing his larynx. ¬†Amongst other things
column15: his soft palate was so elongated (relative to his skull) that it kept getting trapped over his wind-pipe. ¬†-His nostrils were completely occluded
column16: so absolutely no airflow was possible through his nose. ¬†All of his breathing had to take place through his open mouth. ¬†This meant that whilst he was eating/sleeping he was going through bouts of asphyxiation and so would have to spit the food out or wake up and open his mouth - purely so he would be able to breathe. ¬†This explained the ‚Äúchoking‚Äù sound that there were hearing all the time. ¬†He could just manage to breathe with his mouth open
column17: but this then exacerbated the problems with his soft palate. ¬†- The skin fold over the top of the nose (caused by the squashed face involuting the skin) had caused a crevice of around 2-3 cms deep
column18: where the skin was rubbing against its self. ¬†In this area
column19: the skin was ulcerated and was full of liquid pus. ¬†It was this that the owners were smelling. ¬†This was incredibly painful for the animal and he cried every time I tried to clean it. ¬†-The skin around his feet
column21: armpits and groin was red raw and inflamed. ¬† He clearly was very itchy and had been licking at these areas repeatedly - which had
column23: made them more sore and painful. ¬†This is very typical of a condition called ‚Äúatopy‚Äù which is very common in many breeds
column24: particularly the Bulldogs (French and English).  So at this point
column25: the shocked owners asked what needed to be done to sort him out. ¬†¬†So I had to explain that he would need:¬† ¬†- Bilateral eyelid shortening surgery that would allow the dog to blink properly and prevent further ulcers from forming. ¬†As well as long-term medication to improve the quality of his tears. ¬†- Complex soft tissue surgery of the back of the throat to
column26: (amongst other things) shorten his soft palate to facilitate his breathing. ¬†- He would need both of his nostrils opening up so as to allow adequate air flow to be possible to allow him to breathe/exercise/eat/sleep properly. ¬†-He would need a ‚Äúface-lift‚Äù to remove a large amount of excess skin on the front of his face
column27: to try and open up the fold that was causing so much infection and pain. ¬†-He may need allergy testing
column29: anti-inflammatories etc to try and manage the atopic skin disease that he has.¬† ¬†*He needs all of this fairly urgently. ¬† ¬†*He can‚Äôt have all of this done at once and so will require several anaesthetics and complex procedures to be done over a period of time. ¬†¬† *He is only 5 months old.¬† *He needs all of this doing - just so that he can live a vaguely normal life. ¬†¬† *HE IS SUFFERING.¬† ¬†Also - he is not insured. ¬†It transpired that the new owners looked into insurance but the premium was so high for this breed
column30: that they felt they couldn‚Äôt afford it. ¬†To move forward
column31: he would have to go to a specialist veterinary unit (sadly recently set up to deal with the increasing number of very poorly brachycephalic dogs with extreme conformational issues) and this treatment could cost upwards of ¬£8
column32: 000 to correct. ¬†Once I had discussed all this with the owners - they were understandably distraught. ¬†They had hoped for a ‚Äúcute‚Äù and ‚Äúcuddly‚Äù family pet that they had seen examples of spread throughout popular media. ¬†They had no idea that these problems even existed. ¬†Instead
column33: they now have a much-loved dog that is miserable
column34: has a long journey ahead of it and one that they cannot afford to have fixed. ¬†The family left the room in floods of tears
column35: armed with medication that would temporarily alleviate some of the symptoms and try to make the poor little dog more comfortable. ¬†From what I have later found out
column36: this dog has gone to a rescue centre to be rehomed. ¬†It may have moved away
column37: but its problems most certainly will not have done. ¬†Pugs
column39: English Bulldogs and Shar-Peis are amongst the breeds which are increasingly being abandoned in vast numbers as people cannot cope with their ongoing problems
column40: illnesses and costs. ¬†It upsets us all hugely when we see how many of the problems frequently associated with these breeds are now classed as ‚Äúnormal‚Äù. I will commonly hear ‚ÄúOh it is normal for this breed to struggle with A
column41: B or C‚Äù. NO IT ISN‚ÄôT NORMAL! ¬†These trendy flat-faced breeds are some of the most expensive puppies to currently buy. ¬†There is serious money for people who sell a litter of these puppies and so the incentive to breed is VERY high. ¬†It must be said that there are responsible breeders who are trying to ‚Äúback-breed‚Äù these types of dogs to have longer noses
column43: more open nostrils etc and try to reduce the incidence of these conditions
column44: and these people should be applauded. ¬†However
column45: puppy farms and irresponsible owners are rife
column46: and these ‚Äúbreeders‚Äù don‚Äôt seem to care a jot about the long-term prognosis and what the future holds for ‚Äútheir‚Äù breed.¬† ¬†It is also worth noting that many of these breeds are unable to give birth naturally now too (due to the shape of the puppy‚Äôs skulls) and so the mothers often go through multiple caesareans‚Ä¶¬† ¬†PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE STOP AND THINK before you buy. ¬†Come and talk to US about the breeds that you are interested in - and we shall give you the whole picture. ¬†I am completely exhausted and totally demoralised seeing these type of problems on a daily basis. ¬†There are enough horrible illnesses
column47: diseases and potential accidents out there without being destined to be unwell before you are even born. ¬†¬†  Whilst people are still buying these dogs
column48: people will still breed them and the problem will never go away.‚Äú " False link

Yeah it on kills 1-2 for every 1000‚Ä¶so let‚Äôs see if no one had their vaccinations

column5: 000 people who are now alive who would be dead. Hell that‚Äôs only a quarter of million. ¬†Yeah we shouldn‚Äôt worry about that. ¬† What kind of brain dead fucking idiot says¬†‚ÄúI had that disease and lived so you don‚Äôt need to worry.‚Äù?¬† People survive the plague and cancer too. ¬†Should we only worry about preventable diseases with 100% mortality rates? Or just ones that will kill loudmouth morons? ¬†Just because fate was cruel and spared one idiot does not mean a disease is not a serious health issue.¬†  Ho-ly shit anti-vaxxers make me so mad.  GET YOUR FUCKING CHILDREN VACCINATED  ‚ÄúFuck the weak‚Äù is what I heard  I wish there was a vaccine for goddamn fucking anti-vaxxer bullshit.  I am not anti or pro. I believe each individual should make their own choices. And I am SO TIRED of seeing all of you behave like a bunch of crazed assholes to those who dare disagree with you. Please point all that energy inwards and work on improving yourselves. I know 1/3 of you smokes cigarettes. And 2/3 of you drink soda. How do you like to be screamed at and be called names for your choices that others consider stupid?  ‚Ä¶my drinking soda doesnt really have the potential to kill someone else‚Äôs baby????????  And like

column1: xompeii 160201487493 "2017-05-01 20:04:00 GMT" https://xompeii.tumblr.com/post/160201487493/i-faked-a-head-injury-to-be-able-to-use-the "brinconvenient:  alx-972:  I was told that they had spoken with their attorney and had been told that I was legally required to use either the men‚Äôs room or non-gendered restrooms
column2: and that if I didn‚Äôt listen I would receive detentions
column3: and possibly more. I came prepared
column4: with printed and highlighted court cases
column5: state statutes
column6: and title IX excerpts. They didn‚Äôt listen
column7: and refused to provide notes on the meeting or confirm that they had plans to punish me. I listened for about a week
column10: and stopped. I concurrently sent a FOIA Request for the communication between the school administration and the attorney
column12: submitted another request for a clarification of what happened in the meeting and the guidance they had given me. I was called down to my dean‚Äôs office and told to calm down. I didn‚Äôt. I instead sent my principal a letter and CC‚Äôd every faculty member of importance at the school. Mr. Jay Hoffmann and Associates
column13: I regret to inform you that I sustained a mild head trauma some time before break
column14: I am in fair condition and high spirits
column15: but I must alert you to the fact that my memory was slightly affected by the incident and I have lost the ability to recall a particular event that took place in mid October
column16: 2011. While I am not completely able to remember the exact happenings of said event
column17: through a series of email searches I have managed to determine that this meeting concerned my ability to use the bathroom while attending school
column18: but I have no recollection as to what specifically happened at the aforementioned meeting. If there happened to be anything of importance said during the October meeting concerning special instructions on how I am supposed to function within the school due to your understanding of my body or identity
column19: I would like to know. Due to my active role within my community
column20: the chances of me sustaining another memory altering head injury within the near future are staggeringly high‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääif you and your staff would like to avoid explaining what happened in the initial meeting and subsequent meetings with great frequency
column22: I highly suggest that you provide me with an official letter concerning any special instructions or punitive actions to be taken against me if I fail to comply. Since this head injury
column23: I have used the school‚Äôs facilities as permitted by the Illinois Human Rights Act and will continue to do so until I am told differently in writing. Please note that any punitive actions taken against me will most likely result in a filing with the Human Rights Committee
column24: FOIA requests for all communications pertaining to the event
column27: and the raising of community awareness. I didn‚Äôt get called to the office anymore after this. In fact

column30: there have been roughly a dozen other trans kids who have gone un-bothered by the administration Could this have gone differently
column31: particularly if I wasn‚Äôt in a state with laws on the books to help me? Definitely. But the point is
column32: draconian laws are much harder to enforce on people who will fight you. If you‚Äôre a trans high schooler
column33: have Title IX complaints typed up‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääyes
column34: you can still file those‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand let your administration know that you have them. Go scream at your school board until they carry you out. Show up at your principal‚Äôs office until you become a nuisance. Fax your superintendent until their machine runs out of ink. Send FOIA requests for everything you can think of
